topics: Recursive function, Arrays (1-Dim & 2-Dim), and Introduction to memory management
Introduction to Java object oriented concepts & classes instantiation
File handling part I in Java
File handling part II in Java

grading.policies: Assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.

policies.attendance: Students are required to attend all lectures. Random attendance signoffs will be performed. Each student is permitted one absence per semester without penalty.
policies.late_work: 50% points will be deduced for the submission week after the due date. The homework will not be accepted after one week of the due date.
policies.academic_integrity: Students must write and sign the Honor System pledge on all submitted work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: This course is fully online. Weekly materials will be released via Canvas on Sunday.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, live web conferencing using Zoom, Github tool.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course is a hands-on intensive introduction to solving engineering problem using Java.
learning_outcomes: Recognize the basic concepts of the programing languages Java
Construct various Java statements, datatypes, such as integer, float, arrays, strings, and pointers
Isolate and correct common errors and bugs in Java programs using debugging tools (e.g. IntelliJ, Eclipse, NetBeans)
Understand class object and instantiation of classes.
Apply object-oriented concepts that encapsulate internal details to solve real problems in Java
Analyze Java programs based on end-user and developer requirements
Understand and apply knowledge dealing with input and output scenarios
